speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: The quality of your voice clone is directly dependent on the quality of your source audio. Garbage in, garbage out.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: Your source audio file should be as clean as possible. This means no background music, no noise, and no other people speaking.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: The ideal length is between three and ten seconds. Less than three seconds may not provide enough data, and more than fifteen seconds can sometimes introduce instability.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: The speaker should be talking in a normal, neutral tone. Highly emotional performances with shouting or whispering can make for a poor quality clone that is difficult to direct later.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: You can use the Transcript Helper tab to record your own voice or to trim a longer audio file down to a perfect, clean sample.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: Once you have a high-quality sample, you can use a feature to make your workflow much faster. Let's explore that next. Please load chapter ten.
